message.content:
It is difficult to ascertain the exact amount of energy required for such a process, as the exact details and methods of transforming into a bird would vary greatly depending on numerous factors. Additionally, the concept of transforming into a bird falls within the realms of mythology and fantasy rather than real-world physics.

However, considering hypothetical examples in literature or media (e.g., shapeshifting witches or magical creatures), we could attempt a rough estimation using an energy measure like calories.

1. If you are turning into an avian species similar in size to your human form(i.e., mass remains constant):

Since one main difference between humans and birds lies in their musculoskeletal structure adaptation for flight, there will be some reorganization/control redistribution among their body constituents that incur additional energy expenditure during work up

Assuming 6 hrs activity with MET value ranging from 3(for slow hovering) - 12(for flapping wings)[source: American college sports Medicine] , daily calorie intake needed would easily range around: 

- Basal rate :1500 kcal
- Activity boost: Extra (8 x1200 +4x250)/2 = 5800 Kcal/day


Keep this source of energy checked by eating an adequate quantity rich in high-calorie food throughout.


DISCLAIMER:

These numbers represent purely speculative estimations based on fun thought experiments and do not hold any scientific weight regarding actual consequences/effects observed during transformation practices(if existed).
